description:
`bigip_ltm_snat` Manages a snat configuration

For resources should be named with their "full path". The full path is the combination of the partition + name of the resource. For example /Common/my-pool.

tfcfnid.description: Internal identifier for tracking resource changes. Do not use.

Mirror.description: Enables or disables mirroring of SNAT connections.

Partition.description: Displays the administrative partition within which this profile resides.

Snatpool.description: Specifies the name of a SNAT pool. You can only use this option when automap and translation are not used.

Sourceport.description: Specifies whether the system preserves the source port of the connection. The default is preserve. Use of the preserve-strict setting should be restricted to UDP only under very special circumstances such as nPath or transparent (that is, no translation of any other L3/L4 field), where there is a 1:1 relationship between virtual IP addresses and node addresses, or when clustered multi-processing (CMP) is disabled. The change setting is useful for obfuscating internal network addresses.

Translation.description: Specifies the name of a translated IP address. Note that translated addresses are outside the traffic management system. You can only use this option when automap and snatpool are not used.

Vlans.description: Specifies the name of the VLAN to which you want to assign the SNAT. The default is vlans-enabled.

Vlansdisabled.description: Disables the SNAT on all VLANs.
